channel.title: Null Null Null All Clients! :@
channel.description:
ok im getting sick of this null thing. its in EVERY client i use. what is wrong. is there some kind of Cache thing on the computer thats wrong or something? please pics below :mad:
[IMG]http://i241.photobucket.com/albums/ff84/akonemi/nullagain.jpg[/img]
[IMG]http://i241.photobucket.com/albums/ff84/akonemi/Null2.jpg[/img]
[IMG]http://i241.photobucket.com/albums/ff84/akonemi/Null3.jpg[/img]

item.title: Null Null Null All Clients! :@
item.dc:creator: @Spades Spades
item.description:
@Spades wrote:

[quote=“SirPali, post:6, topic:331354”][quote author=Lassergutt link=topic=427710.msg3141312#msg3141312 date=1267561558]
I am using the right client…
[/quote]

Probably not. You say you have it with EVERY client you use, therefor, I’m pretty sure you are using the wrong client(s)[/quote]

He may be using the correct client, some people are retards and release a server with a client that is not fit for the server, what you have to do is go threw and either remove all the nulls from the shop or go threw hours of searching to make them all non nulls, which it is better to just remove and start from the beginning anyways. Private Servers have been nothing but customs. Somebody needs to release or work on a client that is fresh and new again. Not 6,000 customs with crappy gameframe

Read full topic

Lassergutt:

I am using the right client…

Probably not. You say you have it with EVERY client you use, therefor, I’m pretty sure you are using the wrong client(s)

item.title: Null Null Null All Clients! :@
item.dc:creator: @Lassergutt Lassergutt
item.description:
@Lassergutt wrote:

I am using the right client…

Read full topic

item.title: Null Null Null All Clients! :@
item.dc:creator: @Raams Raams
item.description:
@Raams wrote:

Lmao. Those are customs items for the source and your using the wrong client. Just remove them from the shops??? Simple?

You see, when someone adds customs to a client they add a model for the item id and your server was made for that client that had those models. When your running a client that doesn’t have the models or ints it will just say the item is “null.”

Read full topic

item.title: Null Null Null All Clients! :@
item.dc:creator: @Yoyomonchien Yoyomonchien
item.description:
@Yoyomonchien wrote:

You need the client that goes with the server to see these “nulls”. Another client just won’t recognize them because they’re customs.

Read full topic

item.title: Null Null Null All Clients! :@
item.dc:creator: @Mr_Despair Mr. Despair
item.description:
@Mr_Despair wrote:

Null is self explanatory. You’re probably just not using the client that came with the source. If you use another custom client with the source, some or all items will be nulled because the items are in the client that came with the source, not the one your using.

Read full topic
